reviews.review_text: Hit it! Wow! Maybe the best meal Ive had in Vancouver. So many incredibly delicious things with great service. We had early reservations which youll need to make at least a month in advance. We sat at the bar which had great ambiance. The staff did an amazing job of the small details and with the dishes. The charcoal udon was just so incredible. Out of the 6 dishes we got, the only one I did not enjoy as much was the salmon. It wasnt bad but I just found it not at the same level as the other dishes. Still for me five  !

Its 5 across the boards! Service would be a 10 if it went that high. Most of the dishes we had were exceptional and a couple just very good what impressed me the most was the unpretentious nature. Our server was extremely knowledgeable and she would look up some info if she didnt know that her than just make something up. Its expensive for sure, but like some other Michelin star restaurants you dont leave wondering if the food and experience were worth it. If you want to spoil yourself have the $90 Japanese truffle omelette... Wow!

Good food with amazing service. Everything was done perfectly and there was nothing that we didnt like. Went with the omikaze and the recommended sweet spot for pricing of approximately $170 - $200pp. We werent too hungry so the waiter went more for higher quality food rather than quantity. The waitress asked a series of questions in order to tailor the menu to us a little which was nice. Youll want to make a reservation if you want a better chance at getting a seat. Walk-ins are possible but fill up quick. Paid street parking is available and relatively cheap (couple of dollars for the 2-3h duration we were there). Definitely a nice experience and worth trying at least once if you get the chance, but it is quite pricey. For the total price you could eat at a few nice restaurants instead, but lifes short and you cant take your money with you so as long as the wife is happy, youll be happy. Parking: Decent priced street parking. A couple of dollars for the 2-3h duration that we were there.

It s worth the hype, the food is excellent, the cocktails are top of the list on Vancouver. The specials are delicious and surprising. It s not super affordable, but that is expected for a restaurant of this level. They know what they do and everyone executes their roles to perfection, from the hostest to the service to the cooks.

Awesome place with great food, service and atmosphere. Unlike other fine dining places I felt like this one is more informal and also provide bigger bang for your buck in terms of portions. At the same time the quality of food is superb. We had oysters, octopus salad, olives, spaghettoni, and chicken, everything was excellent. I recommend a la carte menu as it comes more affordable than prix fix and still lots of food to try. Overall unforgettable experience and I would definitely come back. It s too bad that it s highly popular and you need to keep looking at the booking it one month in advance.

We just had an amazing dinner here for our 10 year wedding anniversary. Everything we ate was incredible. We had the octopus salad, the off the menu omelette (yes it s worth the price!), the udon noodles dish and the Tallarin. service was fabulous the only thing I d like to flag is that when we arrived we were surprised by a complimentary offering of champagne for our anniversary. We don t drink so we had to turn it down. Nothing else was offered in exchange and even though we did order two mocktails they weren t comped. It s fine. We didn t expect it but it does feel like a slight whenever the same offerings arnt given to sober people. Regardless I still left a 22% tip to the waitress who did a great job but it just left a bit of a sour ending to an otherwise perfect experience. Total bill for 4 dishes, 2 mocktails after tip was $250

May be my best meal in Vancouver. Service was top notch. My fave dish was the charcoal udon. My lowest ranked dish was the MP whole fish at $90 (although still delicious - just wish the batter had a bit more flavour, maybe)? The yuzu cream was amazing. Tiramisu was moist and fluffy.

The desserts are my favorite. Pastas are all pretty tasty and with unique unusual flavors (curry, yuzu, etc) The duck breast is very tender and the mushrooms are the most delicious. The salmon is very so so. Mock tail is pretty impressive.

Haven t been back since they had the  miso bread .  To my dismay this dish is cancelled which to be honest was the only dish I remembered from my last meal here. Service was exceptional, and every dish was a delight except I would skip the rib eye.   Nothing wrong but for the price / taste my preference would be either Elisa or Victor and prepared traditionally.

First time here for the omakase, the experience was amazing as well as the food. The highlight for me was the whole fried fish, I thought Id love the A5 waygu the most but the fish was something else. Bring friends to enjoy the food and drinks, but beware the drinks add up quickly.

Food was spectacular, especially the charcoal udon. Service was kickass, Chloe was so friendly and knowledgeable! Everything was explained in an entirely accessible way and she was just super great when at our table. Haiku on the back of the bill card did not adhere to 5-7-5 syllable structure but maybe I m wrong?

Tried nearly everything on the menu- started with the half dozen oysters, fried olives, carne cruda, and octopus salad. The octopus, brined for 24 hours, was addictive- perfectly crispy and smokey. I wasn t a big fan of the cruda, the flavor profile was a little fruitier and more melon-y than I d expected. For the mains, we got all 3 pastas- tajarin, spaghettoni, and charcoal udon. The chef prepared a morel risotto for one of our friends, who s vegetarian. The pastas were clear standouts of the evening and I highly recommend getting all of them if you can (and the risotto, if it s available). The spaghettoni was our favorite- the ragu exemplifies Japanese curry at its epitome. Tajarin was incredible too. The salmon and duck mains were underwhelming compared to the rest of our meal. The salmon was very acidic, and the portion was tiny. The duck was perfectly cooked and the accompanying jus was great, but still paled in comparison to each of the pastas. For dessert, we got the cannoli, tiramisu, and panna cotta. In my experience, dessert at Michelin star restaurants tends to fall short of expectations, but not here! Every dessert was exceptional and perfectly balanced. Service was great, and our drinks were amazing. My beach club mocktail was a wonderful balance of sweet and savory.

This was quite possibly one of my favorite meals Ive ever eaten. We started with the Tonno Mantecato, which has a sourdough base covered with furikake. There is a whipped potato pate combined with bits of tuna, creating a whirlwind of vibrant flavors and textures. I then enjoyed the Charcoal Udon, which was exquisite. The noodles were fresh and prepared perfectly. A healthy save quantity was flavored with tastes of curry powder, lemon, and herbs, and it was combined with squid ink and fresh seafood. My wifes Shaghettoni was a curry flavored twist on Balognese.  We finally finished things with their tiramisu, which also had a Japanese flair, using soy and plum wine. Everything was delicious and seemed generously priced for the portions. I would gladly give Kissa Tanto 6/5 stars if I could.

Made a reservation for 1 over the phone followed up with credit card confirmation. Food, wine and portions are great. It was my last night so decided to splurge and try 4 dishes. Carne Cruda, octopus salad, fish crudo. Spaghettoni  was a dish that I definitely wanted to try to make at home. Who knew curry and spaghetti sauce would go so well together. Definitely come back

What an experience!! The cozy jazz vibe charmed me as soon as i passed the door. The decor is beautiful, with great attention to the light, the different space and the bar. The service was great. The food was exceptional! The amazing fusion Japanese/italian menu surprised me in the best way. And the tiramisu was one of the best I ever had! A well deserved Michelin star.

What. An. Experience. I was lucky enough to snag the last walk-in seat at the bar as a solo diner at Kissa Tanto on a Saturday evening. It s an intimate but lively space. I was grateful that they do an omakase/chefs menu for one since many restaurants in the area require a minimum of 2 for that option. The tasting menu starts at $155 but you can  name your price  north of that amount for a more premium experience. I did the  standard  experience and was blown away (nothing seemed standard about it!). The meal started with a delightful pickle plate and then to oysters and a heavenly crispy octopus salad. Sausage-stuffed fried olives then led to the most delicious Japanese omelette I ve ever had (or really the most delicious egg dish of any kind I ve ever had). It was so rich and decadent with the brown butter and king crab meat. A fresh, egg yolk pasta followed (not pictured) and a beautifully composed salmon rounded out the night. Dessert was a matcha dusted blueberry mascarpone cannoli. Every bite of food was so elegant and flavorful. It s such an interesting marriage of Japanese and Italian flavors and techniques. For drinks, I had the shore leave martini which I very much recommend for any martini drinker. Besides the outstanding food, I think this may have been the best service I ve ever had at a restaurant. The bartenders who took care of me, Cassandra, Fraser, Denis, and Avi were truly the best - genuinely kind people who you can tell love what they do. Cassandra was my main bartender and went above and beyond and then some. She had on-point recommendations for the food and drinks but then gave me a list of her favorite restaurants and bars in Vancouver. Not only that, she even texted a friend who owned one of the bars she recommended to let them know I was coming and save me a seat on a busy Saturday night. I have so much appreciation for all of these wonderful people. I d go back for the service alone!

Absolutely 10/10 experience. You know how sometimes you go to a Michelin star or recommended restaurant and it s sometimes actually not very good? This was not that at all. I ve been waiting months to eat here and it exceeded my already very high expectations! We asked our very cool server for his recommendations to go with our entree, and he crafted a perfect seafood-centric meal for us: octopus salad to start, butternut squash crab ravioli that wasn t on the menu, leading up to the charcoal udon. We had some natural wine and dessert of tiramisu and yuzu cream, which I haven t had anything like before and was delicious. It was truly an intellectual experience. The atmosphere feels authentically refined and jazzy and transported me to 1980s Shibuya and I felt like a businessman that closed a deal. I was so engrossed in the meal that I forgot to take more photos

My partner and I had a wonderful time dining here on a Saturday evening! Its a cozy, unpretentious place with some of the most amazing food either of us had ever tasted. The charcoal udon dish was the star of our night, with a mind blowing sauce and delicious fresh seafood. Service was also great and although prices were high, not unreasonable for a special occasion and quality.

Kissa Tanto lives up to the hype. The fusion fare is refined and intentional, yet not lacking in depth or complexity. Execution and presentation was spectacular but not pretentious. Youre not coming here for the fancy service (even though the service was great) or the beautiful views, youre coming here for fantastic a-la-carte style food that leaves you wanting just the right amount of more. We started off with the oysters which didnt stand out. But then came our first appetizer, two ounces of delicately seared A5 Wagyu with a vibrant, peachy emulsion. The melt-in-you-mouth steak on its own did the trick, but the sauce brought it to a whole other level. Our second appetizer was a black truffle omelette. In contrast to the elegant Wagyu, this omelette was technically brilliant and beautifully messy. The truffle was not at all overpowering, and the eggs really stood out as the main star of the show, rightfully so. This was probably my favorite individual dish. The pastas were the centerpieces for me, they underscored the Japanese-Italian fusion and tackled the flavors involved masterfully. Surprising yet delightful flavors throughout. We ended our main courses with a whole flash-fried fish. The seasoning was great and the fish was tender. I didnt love the daikon soy sauce, but the meat was flavorful enough that I didnt mind eating it without anything else. We finished off with a tiramisu and a cannoli. The tiramisu left me a little disappointed, the plum and coffee flavors really overpowered the delicate and light mascarpone and whipped soy base. But the cannoli was fantastic, deep, and perfectly decadent. A refreshing side of yuzu ice cream helped offset the richness of the chocolate and matcha, which was much appreciated. Overall, Kissa Tanto was great and I would definitely recommend it if youre looking for unique and technically excellent food that you really dont have to try hard at all to enjoy.

Absolutely marvelous! If you can make it for the 5:30 seating, youll often get to experience Chef Watanabe and the restaurant manager greet you on your way in, adding to the warm and welcoming atmosphere.  The food was phenomenal.  You could tell there was so much thought and effort put into each dish, it was unlike any other meal Ive ever had.  Our server was very friendly, warm and prompt with her service, everything was timed perfectly. Well done Kissa Tanto team! 10/10
Delicious food. We loved their octopus salad, carne crude, and charcoal udon. Tiramisu was exceptional! Tajarin and whole fried fish were a little disappointing. Overall excellent but slow service.

Kissa Tanto is a fine dining Japanese-Italian fusion spot thats tucked upstairs in the heart of Chinatown. We have always wanted to try it before the Michelin Star award and we understand why after our experience. Flavours of every dish were unique and did not disappoint. Bartender Fraser was very friendly and made the dining experience that much better with his recommendations. The Carne Cruda is a must for all tartare lovers as it was a nice blend of wagyu, pears and parmesan cheese. The cannoli was off the menu and it was a perfect way to finish off this really delicious meal. Also try the Ocotopus Salad.

I saw a photo of the deep fried perch a few months before their Michelin award and so they went on my list of restaurants to try. It was not until our friends told us how much they enjoyed the interior that I started checking OpenTable regularly for reservation openings. 5:30 is when the restaurant opens. We got a table at the bar and lined up in the rain in Chinatown outside Kissa Tanto with other keeners. When the door finally opened, we all filed upstairs to the 2nd floor restaurant. My partner and I were pleasantly surprised by the interior: nice level of lighting, nice looking lighting fixtures, nice colors, a bar that is not cluttered. Seems like everything thing was placed there for a photoshoot   a comfortable space that is pleasant on the eyes. The images that came to mind were women in short hair with cloche hats or sparkly headbands dancing to Charleston music. THE FOOD. Since there were a couple of items that we did not desire in the fixed menu, we ordered a la carte. The Burrata Salad was supposed to come with organic greens, but they were served with beets instead. Even better! It turned out to be the best beets salad Ive ever had. There were different types of beets, including dried, and fermented(?). All delightful, with their very own flavour, but an overriding tangy orange dressing. I particularly love the softened black pieces that almost taste like olives   I am guessing they are fermented. We received Michelin standard table service. Fresh plates and cutlery were provided for each dish, and the servers wiped our bar top between each dish. That really enhanced our anticipation of the next item. For carbs (Tender to the Tooth), we chose charcoal udon. The udon was made with semolina and spelt   very chewy, very delicious. The chilli butter provided just the right zest. The first two dishes were so good I wanted to order a repeat of the beets burrata and charcoal udon again. I guess thats a reason to come back again and hopefully, they still have these delicious dishes(!) Now for the deep fried perch. It was large enough for us, and so beautiful I didnt want to destroy it. We were told not to waste the meat in the cheeks but I couldnt identify where the meat was. In any case, it took us a while to extract the meat to make sure we do the fist justice. It was a fun thing to have, but next time, I might go for the sable fish instead, if nothing else, to reduce the amount of deep fried food in our diets! I cant write about the seasonal vegetables side dish because it was boring and I decided to focus on the fish. Now to dessert   it is not something we normally order due to our low sugar diet. But being able to get in to Kissa Tanto was a big deal and we werent ready to leave yet. We are lactose intolerant, the ingredient of the Tiramisu is soy mascarpone. So, we tried it. Wow, so light, and not sweet at all   We breathed it in! We have been to other Michelin Star restaurants in Vancouver. But this was truly the best weve encountered so far. If I can give six stars I would. Truly an evening to remember and repeat! And repeat!

This place meets all expectations. We took the 10:15p reservation because that s what you do for truly epic cuisine. The chef s dishes are imaginative, unique, and insanely delicious. Hands down one of the best meals I ve had in 2021 and I ve had some real bangers! The decor and vibe is hip and oh so romantic (low lighting always makes for a romantic night on a rainy day). The service was great especially as it relates to recommendations. The menu descriptions can be difficult to follow when imagining the taste, so our server was great at guiding us. Did we order too much? Yes. Do we regret it? Not a chance.

I came here last Thursday and thoroughly enjoyed the ambiance of the place and the service. We booked a month in advance and were seated at the cute nook by the window! The server was very knowledgeable about how the flavours of the cocktails are and how the food was cooked. Checked in to make sure we were happy throughout the evening. Music wasnt loud. Bathrooms were clean. Pricey but was well worth it. Proper unpretentious fine dining experience . Highly recommend! Definitely get the plum cocktail and the fried rockfish dish. Those were my favorites!
For the most great food. There were a couple of dishes that were short of my expectations. Definitely try the udon.

My favourite restaurant in the world--from the attentive service to the expertly crafted dishes, no matter where Ive dined around the world this restaurant stands out. The tajirin pasta and omelet (not on the menu--ask them about it!) are two favourites but the whole menu is incredible, I cant recommend them enough!

Went for dinner with the family for my brothers graduation. Exceptional service, we got the a la carte chefs menu and tried a bit of everything. Stellar cocktails from Fraser their bar manager- and terrific wine reccos from hannah. Albeit a tad pricy it is Truly a proper fine dining experience in Vancouver, and you ll be sure to be amazed by the interesting and delectable tastes. the fantastic interior will transport you to a jazz bar intertwining both japanese and italian styles that translate into their dishes. can t recommend enough- i ll be coming back asap- everything was perfect, which is rare.

Took my sister for as a special occasion meal - it didnt disappoint. The food was so delicious, we re a big fan of cheese. Our first round had the carne cruda - and I think we couldve ordered this on repeat. We also ordered the tajarin, my sister had eaten this years ago at Kissa Tanto and she said it was still as amazing as it was back then. The sablefish was our other favourite of the evening along with the chill mushrooms it was served with was so tasty but didn t overpower the fish. The yaki onigiri & tuna mantecato were also tasty, they reminded us of comfort foods.

Let me start with the fact that this is likely the best restaurant Ive ever been to. The ambiance is lovely, the drinks great, the service amazing, and the food... Well the food was crafted with expertise. Sometimes you eat a meal and it tastes good, but you know that they used bold and easy-to-use flavors. This was delicate, yet with enough power that it was leaving me speechless. Please, for your own sake, try the charcoal Udon - it may not change your life, but it changed mine :)

Fresh ingredients and creative menus combining Japanese and Italian cookings. Most dishes are very flavorful and a nice balance between various layers of flavors. The Omakase/tasting menu dishes are all family style and meant to be shared. There are 14 dishes for 4 of us and we were stuffed. It is $120 per person. There was a three-hour limit for seating. Cocktails were ok. Vibe and service are good for family gathering or dating.

I am normally not a fan of of food like this: fancy and $$$. But I absolutely LOVED this restaurant. We got the autumn salad, fish crudo, octopus salad, charcoal udon, braised greens and whole fried fish. The autumn salad was probably my favourite dish of the night. I normally do not like beets and this was refreshing yet creamy and all the flavors worked well together. I still crave it til this day. The fish crudo and the octopus salad were both great- seafood tasted fresh and tender. The charcoal udon was very unique; I did find it a tad salty but it was otherwise delicious. The whole fried fish was amazing as well. I do not know what fish I was served but it was great - the soy daikon is mandatory to have with the fish cause otherwise its too greasy on its own. The braised greens were served with the fish but that was the one dish that I found I did not like. It was VERY bitter (not sure if they cooked it enough because it was honestly inedible) but thankfully it was just a small side dish so we simply left it so we could enjoy everything else. Yes, the prices are quite high but they obviously use fresh ingredients and the highest quality so it is worth it. I would definitely come back here if I had a special event. Also, make sure you have a reservation!! We reserved much in advance so we fortunately had a seat but it filled up very quickly because its a smaller restaurant and it is popular.

If Michelin was to rate Canadian restaurants, this one is a real candidate for all 3 stars. The atmosphere, the service, the food quality were all top notch. The freshness of produce was extremely satisfying. The exquisite blend of flavours, innovative approach to combine Italian with Japanese. I love fusion food, and this one took me to heaven and back when I got the bill :)

First, the ambiance in this place is amazing! It s cozy, feels small at first sight but they have plenty of seatings including the bar. The staff were so welcoming and they explained everything on the menu with great passion, especially Daniel :) thanks for making this a great first-time visit! The menu is quite limited, however, every dish we ordered was phenomenal! Kudos to the chef! Looking forward to visiting again!
Came here for a special occasion. Food here was very very good. Great service to match. Will be coming back.

Fantastic meal at Kissa Tanto! The Fish Crudo to start was delicate and fresh. Next, the Tonno Mantecato. One of the most interesting and unique dishes I ve had in a while. Sourdough bread topped with tobiko server aside a tuna and potato pate. Overflowing with umami. The spaghettoni was the most Italian forward of the menu options, a delicious ragu atop thick udon noodles. To finish, the sablefish was a delicate delight.

Start off by saying the flavours were unreal, some of the best we ve ever had. The charcoal udon and the pappardelle are top tier and the chicken was so soft and crispy. Perfect meal overall and service was
The drink What The Flower amazing.   Brunch is very, very good worth it in value.

exceptional food and service. it s a smaller restaurant with an intimate, classic atmosphere. the food is truly unique i recommend asking for their customizable tasting menu. they tailored everything to my requests, and every dish was richly flavorful. loved this dining experience!

Theres a really good reason that this place can be hard to get into. Its just fantastic. Your water glass will never be empty and service is knowledgeable, efficient, and very sophisticated. Beautiful cocktail menu with all the classics done with a slightly retro Asian/Italian influence, and the food... Im not sure where to start. Try it all!

Top tier experience. Get the off menu omelette. Our server, Chloe, was a elite professional who provided a perfect experience. Kitchen made a custom vegetarian off menu pasta. White ragu was all time.

The place itself is not fancy and the neighborhood really does not appeal as much, but if you want tasty and an almost guaranteed won t- disappoint, fascinating concept of food and cocktails, Kissa Tanto is an absolute winner that will make you drool and wish you could have one more bite of whatever it is you re having! My favorite is the Charcoal udon and the Tajarin

It s Friday night @kissatanto for pre-Valentine s dinner   and it s our first time at Kissa Tanto. I love the decor as inspired Tokyo jazz cafes. The food (Italian & Japanese) and experience with Belinda S. made us feel so welcomed and at home.  We throughly enjoyed each dish -> here we go! Carne Cruda - Snake River Farms wagyu, nashi pear, charred scallion soy, parmesan, arima sansho, gnocco fritto.  My goodness, this was so delicious! Mezzi Rigatoni - nut fed pork ragu, tomato xo butter, sesame crumb. Homemade pasta and loved the crunch from that sesame crumb Organic Half Chicken - shio koji dipping sauce, herbed oil.  It was so tender and flavourful. Sablefish - nanban oyster mushrooms, chili salmoriglio, marinated currants, pine nuts, sunchoke pure e. My favourite dish as it was cooked perfectly and the flavours made this dish come alive! Yaki Onigiri- grilled pressed rice stuffed with himematsu mushrooms, Parmesan, roasted chicken consomme, pickled shiso, Piave vecchio.  Crunch crunch. Fantastic flavours with each bite. Memorable experience dining at Kissa Tanto.

This place is one of the best restaurants in the city.  Food is delicious, cocktails are creative, service is excellent and the place itself is gorgeous. My only complaint is that they don t open for lunch! I d love to eat here in the day time so I can really admire the interior. We had the fried stuffed olives which were excellent. The octopus salad was super popular as it seemed like every table ordered it. Tender octopus with layers and layers of flavour. Definitely a must try. The tajarin pasta was also very good.  The steak was delicious as well.  Maybe a tad small for the price though.

Had a lovely Omakase dinner last night. The courses were well paced and the amount perfect.  Everything was delicious.  Cocktails were great. Wine recommendations were on point.  No complaints at all.

It is definitely one of my favourite restaurants.  The service is amazing, beautiful ambiance, and  the food is exquisite. My favourite cocktail is my private Tokyo (slight hint of citrus, and touch of sweet~It s unique in taste and a fun drink).  My favourite dishes; I have a few favourite dishes, but if I have to choose my all time favourites are the Tajarin (hand cut pasta with a light mushroom sauce that is ever so soft and flavourful to the palate), the octopus salad, and the carne cruda.  Highly recommend Kissa Tanto for a special occasion or to just treat yourself.

My boyfriends company made an appointment for us to have christmas dinner so we went out. It was an amazing romantic experience! The ambiance is very welcoming and charming. Good wines, food and service. Staff are extremely knowledgeable and make great recommendations. Our server was very professional and friendly. We ordered Octopus salad which their one of popular dish. It was very delicious! I would definitely recommend to my friends and visit again!
So good we came back 2 nights later. Everything is amazing!  Scallops, burrata salad, sablefish, wagyu, mussels, etc. Great cocktail & wine list too.

Simon was our waiter last night and was absolutely excellent. First class service all night, from explaining how the menus worked, to recommendations, to the little things like wiping down the table and resetting after every course, as well as keeping an eye on our drinks! It was refreshing to see that as my partner and I don t tend to drink that the service did not falter because we weren t racking up a huge bar bill! The food was exceptional, and as promised by Simon, the Charcoal Udon was the star of the show! Great experience and the best service we ve received for a long time. Clear to see Kissa Tanto s staff work as a team throughout the night whilst keeping the personal element to their assigned tables.

I finally got to go to Kissa and what a treat! The staff were so wonderful, inviting and attentive. The atmosphere is lovely and the cocktails are excellent. I thought the menu was creative and fun, and it was extremely tasty, well-seasoned and well-balanced. I appreciated the time the staff took to help navigate me through the menu and offer selections as well as make some adjustments due to dietary restrictions. It was an absolute pleasure dining here and I cannot wait to come back.

Three of us went to Kissa Tanto as an early birthday celebration for my wife. It was great seeing how diligent the staff were in maintaining safety standards. I really appreciated that our server asked if it was OK if she and her colleagues filled our water glasses and cleared our plates to ensure we were comfortable. The cocktails were great! The food was equally as fantastic. Its best to dine here family style and share plates with your friends and family. The Carne Crudo, Tonno Mantecato, Octopus Salad were all excellent starters. I really loved the octopus as it was super tender and had a great smoky flavour. The Carne Crudo was like beef tartare elevated to the next level! The Spaghettini Nero was great as well. We had the whole, friend rock fish and we enjoyed it a lot! The fish was seasoned nicely and the deep frying kept it moist with a great crispy outside. Our server, Belinda, was friendly and attentive! Actually, all the staff were great. Service was spot-on! Cant wait to go back again!

Excellent dishes. Everything was a unique taste and all were great. Ive been to restaurants where they have a few good dishes and some that were less great. This wasnt one of them. Salmon, chicken, duck were all super flavourful Dietary restrictions: Did a good job accommodating/modifying dishes to suit person with celiac disease Parking: Parking meter street parking right in front on both sides of the street. Wheelchair accessibility: 2nd floor up stairs so I dont think wheelchairs can be accommodated unless they have a hidden elevator in back.

Dim lit ambience - perfect for late night cocktails or a romantic dinner. Best service. Our server was exceptional. Professional, delightful and switched on.  She will go places   She had red hair Food : 4/5

Love this place (except for one thing which I will mention in the end)! The food was amazing   a fusion of Japanese and Italian, which are both favourites of mine. We had the Burrata, Truffle Omelet, Tajarin (very creamy and mushroomy), Sablefish, Braised Greens (this was a bit salty and was the least favourite of the night) and the Yuzu Cream. Everything was amazing but the highlights were the Sablefish, Truffle Omelet and the Yuzu Cream. The one thing to note was that while the Truffle Omelet was actually very very delicious, it was one of the specials of the night and our server did not let us know how much it was and I was a bit shocked to be charged $75 for the Truffle Omelet. It did not seem like it was worth $75 based on taste and presentation. I don t care about $75 but was not expecting that. Partly my fault, I should have clarified so lesson learned.

The Real Deal. A TRUE Michelin Star restaurant. Every single course was a unique, flavourful, journey. Hands down the best restaurant I ve ever been to in Vancouver. I got the: oysters, burrata, whole fried fish, A5 waygu + drinks, I cannot emphasize this enough, there are no weak points, the entire experience was 10/10. If you re looking for a food experience, this is the place. It will not disappoint.

I wish I could be selfish and rate this 1 star so I can easily get a table next time. Found this place through looking at Tomasz Wagners portfolio, it looks super cool in his pictures and it didnt disappoint me. It doesnt just look cool but both food and drinks were amazing. We enjoyed all the dishes specially the egg omelette with truffle omg!!! Two bonus we got: Our request for specific seating was accomodated. Our server Carolyn is very sweet and attentive, our table is wiped clean every time a new dish is served. She even surprised my fiance with a candle in our dessert for his birthday :). One thing I would like to warn you is the floor is quite slippery, just be careful, I almost caused a scene

A wonderful meal at a wonderful restaurant (not going to comment on the surrounding area).  Everything we ordered was excellent. Service was 5 stars. I requested a booth and we got one. My partner isnt into octopus or ikura but she rated this meal as one of the best ones shes had in Vancouver (and weve been around). We had the octopus salad, salmon neck (special), eggplant, and squid ink pasta with shrimp and crab. Definitely coming back for more!

One of the best dining experiences in Vancouver. Beautiful decor, very nice atmosphere and attentive service. We ordered the fried stuffed olives and the octopus salad as appetizers, both options were excellent specially the salad with such a fine sauce. As mains we had the Tajarin pasta and the Wagyu beef, the pasta texture was so nice and could tell it was handmade, the beef sauce and the mushrooms were delicious. As desert they brought us a tiramisu as it was my Birthday, such a nice detail! Thanks so much! Oh and don t forget to try some of their cocktails :)

Great dinner. Gets very crowded. If you want a reservation you need to book months in advance. They always have seats at the bar and a couple of table for walk in guests. So we came early and where lucky. Food did not disappoint. Really enjoyed the starter (beet salad and octopus salad). Main courses were also great. Good portions and very tasty. Only dessert did disappoint a little bit. Its pricey, but worth it. Love to come back soon..
Was worth the wait and well deserving of its Michelin star rating.   Cuisine was creative and delicious with unique flavours.   Service attentive and proactive.

15/10 service, each staff made it feel like they were invested in our experience. 10/10 food, their take on Japanese-Italian fusion made for a delicately tasting experience. The favourite for the night was the appetizer, octopus salad. The parsley and chili sauce was to die for in contrast to the crunchy, tender but chewy texture of the octupus. For the entrees, was sablefish, risotto (featured) and polenta - personally leaned towards the polenta due to its use of the yuzu balm adding a citrusy element to this heavy dish. For dessert, the tiramisu was so light and fluffy with the soy whip and the added sweetness with the plum wine was a nice touch.

We enjoyed great food and service in an open stylish space.  The cocktails that we tried were all refreshing and delicious. Please note that individuals with mobility issues may not be able to dine here as the restaurant is only accessible through stairs.

Easily one of the best meals I have ever had. My sister got me a GC for my birthday. With 3 gfs in tow, I ve never had a happier food baby. I will definitely be coming back. Food is great, desserts are delightful, cocktails delicious and service was on point. We loved the udon carbonara so much, we ordered a second round for the table. 100% will dine here again.

We book in for the valentine set menu. It came with 3 courses plus dessert. We chose beef tataki as starter, the tenderness of tataki totally impressed us. It goes so well with the garlic chip and the onion and parsley sauces. The lasagna was ok, and the salmon was super creamy and tender. Also, try their Midori sour cocktail, it s so refreshing and fruity, I highly recommend it.

A very popular japanese italian restaurant in town, the entrance is so hidden that you might just walked pass and not noticing.Just a little noisy as is too crowed. Sake kasu marinated fish with yuzu miso dressing? This appetiser is daily recommend, i cant really remember what the server said. I could just let you know is cooked perfectly, all the moist was keep in the fish. The sauce is lovely with the fish, something taste familiar yet more surprise. Crispy smoked octopus, fresh and pickled radishes, mustard greens, parsley and chili puree salad. I just copied this from their menu, is exactly what they describe but they just couldnt mention the flavour. The octopus was fired lovely, great texture. Again their sauce add some magic to a salad. Tajarin cooked butter, roasted mushrooms and miso cured yolk. The chef knows how to play with the sauce for sure, the flavour is like mum, but i think is gods mum who make this pasta sauce. The pasta i would expect a little more al dente and maybe slight less salty will be perfect.
Ordering the off menu specials were fantastic. Their pastas are delicious, we tried them all. The egg omelette is a must, lots of different food to experience.
Impeccable service, gorgeous and delicious food. Thank you for the fantastic evening.

Perfect experience. Awesome food and very attentive service. I am glad a friend of mine told me about this gem a  few days ago. Don t be shy if you try to book online and it s sold out. It s possible to seat at the bar on a first come / first served basis. My friend told me to take our chances arriving early. I was  mentally prepared  to seat by the bar but we were luck to have a table at 6pm provided we would leave before 8.30 as the table was already reserved for others. It was plenty of time for us to try different plates and sip excellent Italian wine. We will, definitely, be back!

Kissa Tanto is one of my favourite restaurants in Vancouver! Normally I m not into fusion food, but they ve nailed down combining both Japanese & Italian flavours and balancing their plates. The ambiance is also another big plus! Since covid, the seats are all spaced out and much more enjoyable then before covid. Bar is also great too, but try to get the bench area if you can. You must try their Tajarin pasta if you come, and if their truffle mushroom risotto is on special get it! I also really love their octopus dish and daily pickled vegetables. Drinks are always great too!

Good atmosphere.  Great service.  Tasty food.  Wide selection of drinks.  This place is ideal for a date with your significant other or a small intimate group dinner (table for 4).  The bar looks like a great place to kick off the night.  This restaurant is situated in the heart of historic Vancouver Chinatown.

By far one of the best restaurants I ve been to in Vancouver! The food was fantastic and they provided exemplary service. I was a bit intimidated of the menu because of its unique options but our server was able to explain it carefully. We ordered the octopus salad, carne cruda, mezzi rigatoni, and tajarin. Would recommend the tajarin and octopus salad they were delicious! Would definitely come back, it s worth the price!

An enchanting dining experience awaits you at this exquisite establishment. The moment you enter, you are welcomed by exceptionally hospitable service and a charming interior that artfully blends Japanese and Italian aesthetics. The culinary offerings are nothing short of phenomenal   expertly crafted and promptly served to satisfy even the most discerning palate. The octopus salad is a must-try, featuring smoky, tender octopus atop a bed of refreshing radish and delicious sauce. Whisper the secret off-menu truffle omelette to your server and be rewarded with an irresistibly fluffy cloud bursting with aromatic truffle flavors. While slightly pricey, its a tempting indulgence. The charcoal udon, drizzled in sublime yuzu cream, is a dish you simply cannot pass up While the visually stunning whole fish delivers tender, succulent bites, although it may not outshine the other standout dishes in flavor. Dessert at this incredible restaurant is the sweetest crescendo: the ethereal tiramisu delivers a luxurious softness accompanied by enchanting Japanese wine notes, and the seasonal mochi tart is an irresistible treat you wouldnt want to miss. This unforgettable gastronomical adventure ranks among the finest dining experiences ever encountered. Dont hesitate to pay a visit and savor these culinary masterpieces! Parking: It might be tricky to find a parking next the restaurant, but you always can find a free spot on Keefer street. Parking is paid ~ 2$ per hour.

Some of the best cocktails and unique Japanese fusion cuisine I ve had. Servers and bartenders are extremely knowledgeable and the service is great. Loved every dish we had, don t be afraid to eat outside your comfort zone.
There is nothing average about their food, all the flavours are intense and interesting.

Great dinning experience, server was great. It was a lovely dinning experience. Love the old school asian decor theme. My only thing was the room was a little warm for my liking. Although my guess thought it was the right temperature.

This restaurant impressed me, and I am somewhat difficult to impress (eg. Hawksworth didnt wow me). The octopus dish in particular was amazing...smoked first and then cooked sous vide...tender and packed with flavour. Cocktails are excellent. Highly recommended.
We enjoyed our meals and cocktails. Our servers were amazingly nice and friendly. They were knowledgeable about the food and drinks and very helpful.

Hands down my favorite restaurant in Vancouver! Honestly has some of the tastiest drinks in the city--my personal fave (Japanese G&T) Pictured: Carne Crudo, Tajarin (add the extra truffle butter!), Spelt Seafood Udon, Mezzi Rigatoni, Braised Greens, Yuzu Creme

This restaurant is bustling and you have to get a reservation well in advance! Their menu is fairly standard but it definitely does not come across that way when it arrives at your table. The yuzu creme is one of the best desserts Ive ever had!
Ordered all 3 pastas and the tiramisu. All were out of this world. There was a pasta special for the day, but the waiter forgot to mention that :( apart from that a perfect meal

Finally got to try Kissa Tanto and it sure didnt disappoint. The food was simply amazing. The layers of flavours and complexity in the dishes shows the chef really understands how to bring out the best in his ingredients as well as play on the umami aspect of the dishes. In terms of drinks and cocktails they have a wide selection. Our favourite (and recommended must try) was definitely the tajarin pasta, octopus salad and yuzu cream dessert. I do suggest starting off with a cocktail but not all flavours cater to everyones palette. So ask your bartender for recommendations. Ever since Air Canada rated Kissa Tanto the best in Canada and Globe and Mail best 100 restaurants we havent been able to secure a reservation. I have to give Kissa Tanto credit for allowing some walk in tables. Without this I am sure most of us would never be able to eat here.

The food was delicious and we all enjoyed it. There are far too many combinations to mention. For apps we had half dozen oysters, followed by my favorite of the night, octopus salad with crispy smoked octopus. We also had Carne Cruda with is a tartare of wagyu, pear scallions, Parmesan and gnocco fritto, simply delicious. We shared main dishes of Charcoal Mafaldine consisting of white ragu of lamb, guanciale, chanterelles and toasted nori. This was followed by organic chicken with ship mojo dipping sauce. The final dish was a large fried perch with daikon soy dipping sauce. This is a unique gem restaurant and worth trying due to its unique disjoin and flare.

OMG I cannot rave enough about this place. 1st lets talk about the service, while waiting for our table, no less that 4 employees acknowledged us and let us know they will be right with us. All this happened in out 1st two minutes. Right there I felt appreciated. The bartender was a phenomenal mixologist, crafting some truly delicious drinks. His version of an old fashion was off the charts! Also since we sat at the bar he took our order which he knew off the back of his hand and made some amazing recommendations. Tops on my list are the oysters. Wagu beef, tiramisu. If I write about every flavor experience I would need 10 pages. To keep it short every plate was well balanced, flavorful and just enough for sharing. Hands down one of the best experiences Ive ever had. Make a reservation well ahead of time and go. You will thank yourself later.
One of my favorite restaurant in Vancouver!! Hidden gem in Chinatown. Very unique Japanese and French fusion. The eggplant is a must every time I come here!
Quaint atmosphere with attentive service and delicious food.  Great wine list and an extra special dessert (olive oil cake).

This place definitely fell ahead of expectations.  Japanese and Italian fusion was very unique.  Everything was cooked perfectly.  Service was impeccable and the atmosphere was really unique.  It was somewhat diner like but high end.

Delicious fusion, I was not expecting anything this delicious. Daniel was wonderful and made the experience 5 star. He had amazing reccomendations  and impeccable timing. Little pricey but worth it for the quality and service. Will go again. We ate the carne to start, was a tartare it was amazing. Ate the duck pasta and Wagyu beef followed by the yozu cream dessert. I would reccomend all of it.

Excellent service and great food and cocktails. I couldnt get enough of the sourdough bread with their umami butter and the pasta dishes. The tiramisu and yuzu dessert was also delightful to end our meal.

I have been looking forward to a visit to Kissa Tonto since its inclusion on a list of best new restaurants in Canada. Reservations are highly recommended and be prepared to have limited selection on dining times. I hate tossing 5 stars out too often. This place definitely earns it. The service, the atmosphere, the food, the cocktails all come together as a triumph. The eggplant fritters and octopus salad were our appetizers. Both were great for sharing. The octopus salad disappointed only due to the wanting of more octopus. Smoked a crispy, it was unfortunate there wasnt more on the plate. We both had the specials of the day for our main course. The tagliatelle was cooked perfectly and the seafood accompaniment complimented each other. No heavy sauces to clutter the flavour. The pork chop was aged 36(ish) days and brined. Crispy outside and juicy and tender on the inside. And the presentation. Just look at that and try and say no.

The food itself is exquisite, very interesting and different flavours. The Japanese and Italian fusion works so well. Enjoyed the Tajarin and the roast chicken! The bread and the butter was even amazing. Definitley try the deep fried stuffed olives to starts Very cool decor and vibe. Wait staff are second to none - very knowledgeable of the menu. Delicious cocktails too.
Amazing food and cocktails! Loved the vibe and the service was top notch! Make sure to not skip the desserts

This was an incredible dining experience. The food on point, the service I would say best I ve had. We had a feature truffle omelette and it was decadent, the pastas all delicious and the tiramisu exactly what I had hoped it would be.

This is our favorite restaurant in Vancouver. The dining room decor is cozy and romantic with beautiful lighting, deep coloured walls, floral wallpaper and gorgeous flowers. The service is absolutely impeccable- I comment on it every time. I think its the best restaurant staff in Vancouver. The food is truly amazing. We always have to have the same pasta and chicken dish in our order, because its just necessary. I also loved the feature lamb pasta on our most recent visit, and previously we tried the fried whole fish (which isnt something I would usually order... but it was insane). Wine, cocktails, dessert are really top notch as well.

Kissa Tanto is a unique dining experience in Vancouver with Japanese-Italian fare.  Reservations are notoriously hard to get, but they do save the bar area for walk ins only.  Sitting at the bar, you ll think you have been transported in time, with mid century modern decor and vinyl records adorning the bookshelves.  The atmosphere is a treat, and the cocktails impressive, but it s the food that keeps us coming back.  The tajarin is spectacular, made with handmade pasta, mushrooms and a dusting of parmesan.  We opted for the truffle addition, but honestly it didn t need it as the mushroom flavors came through just fine.   The drinks are carefully crafted with meticulous detail, keeping with the Japanese Italian menu.  I had the Salary Man s Song made with tart yuzu, and I thought it went quite well with the tartare appetizer.  We did bring our own bottle of wine for a special occasion, but the BYOB cost is pricey at $45.  It s a gem of a restaurant in Chinatown worth checking out!
Absolutely delicious food. Try the Tsukune Agnolotti. It was one of my favourite dishes there with it flavourful complexity. This place should be a Vancouver must visit.
One of the best dining experiences I have had. Not only was the ambience amazing - so was the food & team that served us
Had to wait 45 min so reservation is a must. First time trying. I enjoyed it. Stuffed fried olives were so good. Chicken and pasta both tasty and well prepared.
Great dining experience, we got the octopus appetizer, fried whole fish, and braised greens. The sauces were all very well done and light!
Incredible food & drink. They earned that Michelin star!   Highly recommend!

Ive wanted to try this restaurant for quite some time, but heard its always too busy. My friends are regulars and gush about the food. We didnt have reservations but we got seated in a timely manner. The service was fantastic. The host and the waitstaff were super friendly, and personable. The food and drinks... everything was great. The pasta dishes and octopus were my favorites....as well as the one-of-a-kind cocktails. Everything was on point. I definately recommend making resos and trying it out.
